meanings.definition: To make white or lighter in color by removing color
meanings.sent1: She used bleach to lighten the fabric.
meanings.sent2: Remember to bleach your hair carefully to avoid damage.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef accidentally spilled bleach on the colorful tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to bleach the room with its brightness.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays bleach the sand on the beach over time.

meanings.definition: A chemical used to whiten or sterilize
meanings.sent1: The cleaner contained bleach for disinfecting surfaces.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to wear gloves when handling bleach to protect your skin.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a bottle of bleach at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a splash of bleach in the dull room.
meanings.sent5: The smell of bleach filled the air after the janitor mopped the floor.

meanings.definition: The act of whitening or lightening in color
meanings.sent1: The bleach of the sheets made them look brand new.
meanings.sent2: The bleach of the paint gave the room a fresh appearance.
meanings.sent3: The sudden bleach of the sky signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a natural bleach that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The bleach of the snow in the sunlight was blindingly bright.
